content.description:
A scientist is studying a population of lizards with three different color phenotypes. The color phenotype is controlled by a single gene with two alleles: an incompletely dominant allele <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></math> and a recessive allele <math alttext="lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></math>. The scientist collected data on the color of <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> lizards. The data are shown in the table.

Phenotype
 Genotype
 Number Observed

Red
 <math alttext="uppercase A uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="75" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Purple
 <math alttext="uppercase A lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Blue
 <math alttext="lowercase a lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

To test the hypothesis that the population is at Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, the scientist performed a chi-square test.
content.question: Which of the following values is closest to the chi-square value the scientist calculated?
